section.title: Defining Context-free Syntax
section.para:
illustrates the use of these operators in the extension of the expression language with statements and function declarations. Lists are used in numerous places, such as for the sequential composition of statements (Seq), the declarations in a let binding, and the formal and actual arguments of a function (FunDec and Call). An example function definition in this language is:
function fact(n, x) = if n > 0 then fact(n - 1, n * x) else x
